Protected Attributes

long n
 n = dimension, order in opacity, number of q's to calculate with
long twotothen
 There are 2^n different permutations of setting each q to zero, pre calculate this.
bool correlated
 Are we dealing with a correlated medium? 0 = no, 1 = yes.

 Store2D the z value, ie the zeroes.

 The magnitudes of the q vectors.

 k vector magnitude - the emitted gluon

 k vector polar angle
array1D khatqi
 Array of khat dot q_i (ie khat is unit vector, independent of k magnitude).
array2D sumkhatqi_iton
 Sum of khat.q_i summed from i to n.
array3D sumkhatqikhatqj_itonjton
 Sum of khat.q_i summed from i to n and j to n.
array3D sumkqikqj_itonjton
 Sum of k.q_i summed from i to n and j to n - ie depdendent on k.

Detailed Description

A class to calculate the necessary sums and products of q and k vectors necessary to calculate an opacity expansion. This automates the expansion of the dot products inside the C's and B's in GLV for arbitrary order in opacity, rather than trying to calculate by hand. All sums of q's from i up to the length n are needed, dotted into a sum from j to n. Further, the result but with one or more of the q's set to zero (ie a delta function in the integral) is needed.
Author:
Simon Wicks <simon_wicks@yahoo.com>

00372   _OuterProduct0D1D( n, 1., thk, qs, ths, khatqi );

00374   // Now, calculate sumqiqj_jton[i][j] = Sum[ qiqj[i][jj], {jj, j, n} ];
00375   // ie sumqiqj_jton[i][j] = sumqiqj_iton[i][j+1] + qiqj[i][j]
00376   // sumqiqj_iton[i][j] = transpose sumqiqj_jton[i][j] = sumqiqj_jton[j][i]
00377   for (index2D i=0; i!=n; ++i) 
00378   {
00379     sumqiqj_jton[i][n-1] = qiqj[i][n-1];
00380     sumqiqj_iton[n-1][i] = sumqiqj_jton[i][n-1];
00381     for (index2D j=(n-2); j>=0; --j)
00382     {
00383       sumqiqj_jton[i][j] = sumqiqj_jton[i][j+1] + qiqj[i][j];
00384       sumqiqj_iton[j][i] = sumqiqj_jton[i][j];
00385     }
00386   }
00387   
00388   // Now we calculate the final product
00389   
00390   // sumqiqj_itonjton[i][j] = Sum[ sumqiq_jton[ii][j], {ii, i, n} ];
00391   // ie sumqiqj_itonjton[i][j] = sumqiqj_itonjton[i+1][j] + sumqiqj_jton[i][j]
00392   sumqiqj_itonjton[0][n][n] = 0.;
00393   for (long j=0; j<n; ++j) 
00394   {
00395     sumqiqj_itonjton[0][n][j] = 0.;
00396     sumqiqj_itonjton[0][n-1][j] = sumqiqj_jton[n-1][j];
00397     for (long i=(n-2); i>=0; --i)
00398     {
00399       sumqiqj_itonjton[0][i][j] = sumqiqj_itonjton[0][i+1][j] + sumqiqj_jton[i][j];
00400     }
00401   }
00402   
00403   // Now throw in sumkhatqi_iton[i] = Sum[ khatqi[ii], {ii,i,n} ];
00404   // ie sumkhatqi_iton[i] = sumkhatqi_iton[i+1] + khatqi[i]
00405   sumkhatqi_iton[0][n-1] = khatqi[n-1];
00406   for (long i=(n-2); i>=0; --i)
00407   {
00408     sumkhatqi_iton[0][i] = sumkhatqi_iton[0][i+1] + khatqi[i];
00409   }
00410 
00411   if ( correlated )
00412   {
00413     // Now we go through all the possible combinations of zeroed columns and rows
00414     _Iterate2DForZeroes( n, qiqj, sumqiqj_itonjton );
00415     _Iterate1DForZeroes( n, khatqi, sumkhatqi_iton );
00416   }
00417 
00418   // Now calc sumkhatqikhatqj_itonjton
00419   long zmax; correlated ? zmax = twotothen-1 : zmax = 0;
00420   for (long z=0; z<=zmax; ++z)
00421   {
00422     for (long i=0; i<n; ++i)
00423     {
00424       for (long j=0; j<n; ++j)
00425       {
00426         sumkhatqikhatqj_itonjton[z][i][j] = sumkhatqi_iton[z][i] + sumkhatqi_iton[z][j];
00427       }
00428       sumkhatqikhatqj_itonjton[z][i][n] = sumkhatqi_iton[z][i];
00429     }
00430     for (long j=0; j<n; ++j)
00431     {
00432       sumkhatqikhatqj_itonjton[z][n][j] = sumkhatqi_iton[z][j];
00433     }
00434     sumkhatqikhatqj_itonjton[z][n][n] = 0.;
00435   }
00436 }
